review_title: I used to love my job
pros: I like working with most of my fellow co-workers.
cons: I don't think that ARMC is fair or completely honest with many of its employees due to personal experience with certain people in upper management.

pros: Loved the people who worked there, great food, benefits were good at that time.
cons: My job after 17-years was out-sourced to India so they put an American worker out to trade for having to pay lower wages to get the reports typed up.  Before doing they kept chipping away at your hours and threatening you if you stayed over your allotted time granted and if you for some reason did go over then you were threatened with job loss.  They also got rid of all the seasoned veteran workers and opted to hire new ones from out of school so they could get away with paying less money to the new "less experienced" worker.

review_title: Work in the ER. Nights are VERY short staffed
pros: I LOVE my core work crew. The people are why I am staying right now. Great shift dif and they work with your schedule as best as possible.
cons:
MANAGEMENT. Morale is so low right now on nights when we are 5 to 6 employees short on a nightly basis. Last week we closed down four rooms at 2300 with 10 patients in the waiting room with 5+ hour wait time. This isn't much for some ERs but the nurses get berated heavily by pts ad management when they wait even 2 to 3 hours.

They also just removed our incentive pay for critical needs departments. Because apparently we aren't in a critical needs situation.  I'm just glad there hasn't been forced overtime yet....

pros:
This hospital is a place where in the last few years the CEO and senior team pushes for service excellence, customers first, team work, and respect for your fellow co worker no matter there title.  
The CEO is a great person all around.  He believe in supporting the employees.  But this hospital is owned by UHS so his hands can be tied to some degree with some situations.
cons: In some departments no opportunity for training, education or advancement.

pros: great staff who care and want to do a good job
cons: Vance Reynolds is a horrible leader and a bad person. He lies to his staff and pits employees against each other. He thrives on lying to people and brags about the staff he has fired. He says he cares about the staff but only cares about himself. He is petty and makes fun of his own employees appearances and handicaps. He is a cold, mean person who only cares about himself and his bottom line. He hides behind religion and "servant leadership" but does not believe in any on it.

review_title: positive experience,  good pay, supportive management
pros: salary is good,  benefits are great,  scheduling flexibility,  tuition reimbursement,  free nursing competency credits, twelve hour shifts,  incentive bonus for overtime
cons: minimal input regarding systems, equipment, and patient care protocol, method used in how job performance is measured,  staff development and communication

pros: Great coworkers who were very knowledgeable and helpful to one another.
cons: At the time that I was employed there, management was not great.  We were greatly overstaffed some days, and grossly understaffed other days.  Regardless, we were constantly overworked and rarely had adequate patient care techs to assist us.  Working every other weekend was mandatory; however, this is not uncommon for this type of work.

pros: A steady income with rotating 12 hrs shifts so you don't work every weekend.
cons: Pulling on pt's with now help.  Pulled my back out one night after 9 baths by myself.  Had to find other employment due to the fact I couldn't walk for a few days after injury.  Horrible compensation for the amount of work that is required.
